channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: After devastating LA fires, California is drafting nation's toughest rules for homes
item.description: California is writing rules to limit plants around buildings to protect them from wildfires, after the Los Angeles fires a year ago. Some homeowners a...

item.title: Attempting to predict the economy in 2026
item.description: Economists may have a pretty dismal record with predictions. But we're still interested in what they see in their non-existent crystal balls.

item.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine reco...

item.title: More seniors are becoming homeless. Shelters are trying to adapt
item.description: Older adults are the fastest-growing homeless population across the U.S. Now some shelters are trying to make it easier to accommodate older people.

item.title: The criminal prosecution of Nicolás Maduro is underway. Here's what to expect
item.description: Now begins what could be a lengthy legal process of pretrial motions, potential plea negotiations and possibly a jury trial of the authoritarian leade...

item.title: How police departments' poorly-enforced rules enable off-duty misconduct
item.description: Across the U.S., police officers moonlight in bars, clubs, and private security jobs with little oversight. A CBS News and Howard Center investigation...

item.title: Trump administration halting $10 billion in social service funding to 5 states
item.description: The Trump administration plans to halt billions of dollars in federal funding for social services programs in five states led by Democrats following a...

item.title: European allies back Denmark over Trump's threat to annex Greenland
item.description: Donald Trump has refused to rule out using force to annex Greenland - a scenario that would spell the end of Nato, according to Denmark.

item.title: Former Uvalde officer accused of not protecting students during 2022 shooting goes on trial
GOP Rep. Jim Baird and wife hospitalized after car accident, Trump says
item.description: President Trump said the Republican congressman from Indiana was in a "bad accident."

item.title: Why does Trump want Greenland and what could it mean for Nato?
item.description: The US president's repeated demands to control Greenland could threaten the Nato military alliance.

item.title: What's the maximum income when filing for bankruptcy?
item.description: Income limits vary by bankruptcy type, state, and household size, but they're typically higher than people expect.

item.title: Zelensky replaces Ukraine's powerful security service chief
item.description: The Ukrainian president has come under heavy criticism for his reshuffling of one the country's most successful security agencies.

item.title: Trump claims US oil firms could be 'up and running' in Venezuela within 18 months
item.description: Trump is open about his ambitions for scaled-up US operations, but analysts say such plans would take time.

item.title: U.S. oil companies won't rush to re-enter shaky Venezuela, experts say
item.description: The Trump administration is counting on U.S. oil companies to revive Venezuela's creaky energy production and tap its massive reserves.

item.title: These numbers tell the story of the Los Angeles wildfires, one year later
Iran anti-government protests spread to majority of provinces, videos show
item.description: Videos show that unrest has spread to more than 50 towns and cities, including pro-government heartlands.

item.title: US cuts the number of vaccines recommended for every child, a move slammed by physicians
item.description: The U.S. took the unprecedented step Monday of dropping the number of vaccines it recommends for every child — leaving other immunizations, such as fl...
